system.description: The true healers of the world, they are committed to sustaining all life. The truly altruistic characters, Life Mages are known to enter battles on neither side, healing anyone and everyone who they can. Obsessed with keeping people alive and conquering death, Life Mages are not as righteous as the Paladin but much more humble and kind. Shying away from combat, they prefer to stand behind the troops, healing when needed. If you are playing a Life Mage be helpful, kind and loving, protective but committed to saving lives and fighting death.

overview.base: You may rotate between life rotator spells during a short rest instead of a long rest.
overview.proficient: You are fluent in Life Rotators. (This does not make you fluent in the spells themselves.)

overview.base: When you attack with Light Ray or Medicine Ball, you may target an additional creature or the same creature twice. Any costs you pay must be paid twice and be the same for both attacks These incur attack penalties as though they were two separate attacks.
Add Minor Item Enchantment and Swift Sleep Aura to your list of possible rotator spells.

Target item is enchanted to be magelore and grant a conjured ray spell that you know. Except, the spell is gifted and must be invoked for. The enchanted item is tier 1. If the item is shattered, this enchantment fades.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, the duration of this effect increases by 1 hour. The overall duration is rounded to the nearest hour.
system.requirements: Target is not a weapon.

overview.base: A hypnotizing shimmer spreads through the air around you. Roll [[/roll 1d8]] to determine the strength of this effect.
overview.proficient: Instead roll [[/roll (@p)d8]].
overview.fluent: Instead roll [[/roll (@f)d8]].

results.fail: Any creatures who have fewer HP than the result of the die roll are rendered asleep until this effect ends.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, roll an additional [[/roll 1d8]]. Target is also resistant to being awakened.

overview.base: In addition to the custom rotator spells you create, you can learn spells created by others. When you come across a fully created spell using only words you are fluent in, can make a DC 12 + OP INT feat save to attempt to learn it. If you succeed, you can add it to your rotator spell list. If you fail, you are incapable of attempting to learn that spell again. The GM may modify the DC based on the spell's complexity, your knowledge of the spell, any special training you receive, if the spell's creator is there to assist you, or for any other factors they see fit. You may also attempt to learn words that you come across as long as they are of elements you are fluent in. The GM may adjust the DC for these as they see fit as well, but the default is DC 15 + OP INT feat save.
overview.proficient: You are fluent in Elder Sorcery Creation, Celestial Elder Sorcery Words, and Life Elder Sorcery Words.

results.save: You learn the spell or word.
results.fail: You are incapable of attempting to learn that spell or word again.

overview.base: You gain Limited Spell Strike.
Target takes the "on hit" effect of a conjured missile spell that you are proficient in. If the triggering hit was a critical hit, then the target takes the "on critical hit" effect instead.

system.trigger: You have just landed a hit with a weapon or bite attack on another creature and the effect has successfully applied.
system.limitation: Only usable with Light Ray and Medicine Ball.

overview.base:
Once per short rest, you may cast a ritual life spell in half the time it would normally take. Additionally, once per long rest, you may cast a life spell as though you were adept at it.

You also gain the Emergency and Sheltered casting styles.
overview.proficient: You may now use the benefits from Life Disciplines P times per long rest.
overview.fluent: You may now use the benefits from Life Disciplines F times per short rest.

overview.base: You cast a single action spell at the triggering creature.

system.trigger: You are being attacked by another creature.

overview.base: You may keep the triggering spell from targeting up to P targets of your choice that it would otherwise target.

system.trigger: You are casting a spell.
